content: Singaporean judge of the Supreme CourtThis biography of a living person **relies too much on references to primary sources**. Please help by adding secondary or tertiary sources. Contentious material about living persons that is unsourced or poorly sourced **must be removed immediately**, especially if potentially libelous or harmful. *Find sources:* "Belinda Ang" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(November 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Belinda Ang Saw Ean** [SC](/wiki/Senior_Counsel) (born 24 April 1954) is a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singaporean) judge of the Court of Appeal. Ang received her [Bachelor of Laws](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Laws) from the [University of Wales, Aberystwyth](/wiki/Aberystwyth_University) in 1976 and her [Master of Laws](/wiki/Master_of_Laws) (with distinction) from the [University College London](/wiki/University_College_London). She was appointed [Judicial Commissioner](/wiki/Judicial_Commissioner) in February 2002, Judge of the [Supreme Court](/wiki/Supreme_Court_of_Singapore) in January 2003, Judge of the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court in January 2021, and Justice of the Court of Appeal of the Supreme Court in November 2022. Prior to these appointments, she joined Godwin & Co in 1980 and was made junior partner in 1983. She founded Ang & Partners in 1985, and was appointed [Senior Counsel](/wiki/Senior_Counsel) in 1998. She is a member of the senate and executive committee of the [Singapore Academy of Law](/wiki/Singapore_Academy_of_Law), and is chairperson of the [Singapore Mediation Centre](/wiki/Singapore_Mediation_Centre). This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Belinda Ang
